titles.title: AIDS Control bill
Sexually Transmitted Diseases Amendments of 1993
To amend the Public Health Service Act to extend the program of grants regarding the prevention and control of sexually transmitted diseases.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. H. Rept. 103-131.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 71.

action.text: Mr. Waxman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

bill.summary: 5/20/1993--Introduced. Sexually Transmitted Diseases Amendments of 1993 - Amends the Public Health Service Act to authorize appropriations through FY 1998 for programs for: (1) the prevention and control of sexually transmitted diseases; and (2) the prevention of infertility arising as a result of such diseases.
